author: Cortex XSOAR

commands.description: Returns information on a host associated with an agent.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-get-host-information

commands.description: Returns information on all hosts.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-get-all-hosts-information

commands.description: Applies containment for a specific host, so that it no longer has access to other systems. If the user does not have the necessary permissions, the command will not approve the request. The permission required to approve the request is api_admin role.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-host-containment

commands.description: Releases a specific host from containment.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-cancel-containment

commands.description: Initiates a data acquisition process to collect artifacts from the system disk and memory.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-initiate-data-acquisition

commands.description: Returns a list of all host sets known to your HX Series appliance.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-get-host-set-information

commands.description: Returns a list of all policies.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-list-policy

commands.description: Returns a list of all policies for all host sets.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-list-host-set-policy

commands.description: Fetches all containment states across known hosts.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-list-containment

commands.description: Fetches all enterprise searches.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-search-list

commands.description: Stops a specific running search.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-search-stop

commands.description: Fetches the results for a specific enterprise search.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-search-result-get

commands.description: Searches endpoints to check all hosts or a subset of hosts for a specific file or indicator.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-search

commands.description: Get details of a specific alert.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-get-alert

commands.description: Suppresses an alert by ID.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-suppress-alert

commands.description: Get a list of indicators.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-get-indicators

commands.description: Get details of a specific indicator.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-get-indicator

commands.description: Add conditions to an indicator. Conditions can be MD5, hash values, domain names, and IP addresses.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-append-conditions

commands.description: Deletes the search by ID.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-search-delete

commands.description: Deletes the file acquisition by ID.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-delete-file-acquisition

commands.description: Approves pending containment requests made by other components or users. The required permission is api_admin role.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-approve-containment

commands.description: Inserts a new host set policy on your Endpoint Security server.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-assign-host-set-policy

commands.description: Collects artifacts from the system disk and memory for the given acquisition ID. The data is fetched as a MANS file.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-get-data-acquisition

commands.description: Start a data acquisition process to gather artifacts from the system disk and memory. The data is fetched as a MANS file.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-data-acquisition

commands.description: Returns a list of alerts. Use the different arguments to filter the results returned.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-get-alerts

commands.description: Acquires a specific file as a password protected zip file. The password for unlocking the zip file is 'unzip-me'.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-file-acquisition

commands.description: Create a new indicator.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-create-indicator

commands.description: Deletes a Host Set policy.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-delete-host-set-policy

commands.description: Deletes data acquisition.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-delete-data-acquisition

commands.description: Delete an indicator condition.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-delete-indicator-condition

commands.description: Lists the indicator categories.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-list-indicator-category

commands.description: Delete an indicator.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-delete-indicator

commands.description: Deletes a host set. To use this command you must have admin permissions.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-delete-host-set

commands.description: Creates a static host set. To use this command you must have admin permissions.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-create-host-set-static

commands.description: Creates a dynamic host set. To use this command you must have admin permissions.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-create-host-set-dynamic

commands.description: Updates a static host set. To use this command you must have admin permissions.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-update-host-set-static

commands.description: Updates dynamic host set. To use this command you must have admin permissions.
commands.name: fireeye-hx-update-host-set-dynamic

integration.description: FireEye Endpoint Security is an integrated solution that detects and protects endpoints against known and unknown threats. This integration provides access to information about endpoints, acquisitions, alerts, indicators, and containment. You can extract critical data and effectively operate the security operations automated playbook.
integration.name: FireEye Endpoint Security (HX) v2

playbook.description:
This playbook queries FireEye Endpoint Security (HX) for traffic indicators, including IP addresses, URLs, domains, and ports.

Note that multiple search values should be separated by commas only (without spaces or any special characters).
playbook.name: FireEye HX - Traffic Indicators Hunting

playbook.description:
This playbook queries FireEye Endpoint Security (HX) for file indicators, including MD5 hashes, SHA256 hashes, SHA1 hashes, file names, file paths, and file types.

Note that multiple search values should be separated by commas only (without spaces or any special characters).
playbook.name: FireEye HX - File Indicators Hunting

playbook.description:
This playbook queries FireEye Endpoint Security (HX) for execution flow indicators, including processes name, registry keys, registry values, and applications.

Note that multiple search values should be separated by commas only (without spaces or any special characters).
playbook.name: FireEye HX - Execution Flow Indicators Hunting

playbook.description: This playbook unisolates endpoints according to the hostname/endpoint ID that is provided by the playbook input.
playbook.name: FireEye HX - Unisolate Endpoint

playbook.description:
This playbook facilitates threat hunting and detection of IOCs within FireEye Endpoint Security (HX) utilizing three sub-playbooks. The sub-playbooks query FireEye HX for different indicators including files, traffic, and execution flow indicators.

Note that multiple search values should be separated by commas only (without spaces or any special characters).

Supported IOCs for this playbook:
- MD5
- SHA1
- SHA256
- IP Address
- URLDomain
- Registry Value
- Registry Key
- File Name
- Process Name
- Port Number
- File Path
- FileType
playbook.name: FireEye HX - Indicators Hunting

playbook.description: This playbook will auto isolate endpoints by the endpoint ID that was provided in the playbook.
playbook.name: FireEye HX - Isolate Endpoint

description: FireEye Endpoint Security is an integrated solution that detects and protects endpoints against known and unknown threats. The FireEye HX Cortex XSOAR integration provides access to information about endpoints, acquisitions, alerts, indicators, and containment. Customers can extract critical data and effectively operate the security operations automated playbooks.
name: FireEye HX
